thread.title_full: Artist of the day 23/03: Tanika Charles

author: achaldhillon
title: Artist of the day 23/03: Tanika Charles
text:
(Picture credit: Zahra Siddiqui) Metro.co.uk and record label Killing Moon pick out the new artists you should listen to today. 
Huge David Bowie memorial is scrapped after organisers fail to raise money needed Tanika Charles sounds like : she’s got sunshine trapped in her heart and she starting to let little rays of it out to shine on us all.
Similar artists : Janelle Monáe, Aretha Franklin, The Supremes, Macy Gray
Her story : Rural Canadian resident Tanika Charles never thought she would end up touring the world singing her own original music.
Several years back, she found herself trapped in an emotionally-abusive relationship, up until the point she decided to ‘borrow’ her then-fiance’s car to leg it to Toronto – which, as it turned out, was the best decision she could have made.
After settling and much encouragement from her friends, she ended a backing singer with Bedouin Soundclash, landed due to her big personality and even bigger voice.
She’s since then began her solo effort, which has resulted in her sharing stages with the likes of Estelle, Macy Gray and Lauryn Hill.
What’s so great about her : You’d have to be pretty dead inside to not open your heart to the warmth of Tanika Charles’ music and person.
Her brightness at a very early stage in her solo career landed her spots on some of Canadian TV’s most-prestigious shows, such as Canada AM and The Morning Show, as well as regular spins on national station CBC.
Her most-recent single Soul Run (about her break for freedom from her relationship-based oppressor) has already made an impact over here, receiving a bunch of spins from Craig Charles’ soul music show on BBC 6 Music.
Most-streamed track on Spotify : Soul Run
Most-recent video :

What will she be doing in 2017 : Mainly releasing an album. Currently Tanika is riding a wave of promotional success on the basis of her infectiously-good recent single Soul Run, which funnily enough is taken from an album she has put together of the same name.
Said album is due out 7 April, and doubtless she will be taking her super-fun live show out on the road to promote it.
More: Music Liam Payne's new solo album isn't quite perfect yet, claims Conor Maynard 
Watch Made In Chelsea's Julius Cowdrey perform his new music 
Russia's Eurovision entrant banned from entering Ukraine for the contest 
Signed to : Record Kicks
Upcoming live shows : None announced, but we’re counting the days until they are.
